title: What is the difference between an Ethernet splitter and a router? - Quora

response.answer_text: If you don't trust Ethernet splitters then you can actually build a cable that does the exact same thing. A splitter works by taking two physical Ethernet ports and sending both connections (which must be limited to using 100mbps speeds) though a single cable. A splitter doesn't connect both ports together in any way.

This should help you understand splitters: Ethernet Switch vs. Hub vs. Splitter: What's the Difference? - Make Tech Easier A router routes data packets between computer networks. That’s the simplest definition.
